de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.net
Class MinervaServerEngine

java.lang.Object
  de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.net.MinervaServerEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServerExecutables, de.root1.simon.SimonRemote, java.io.Serializable
public class MinervaServerEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServerExecutables

The server engine, which implements the server protocol. In other words: Contains methods, which can be invoked from any client. It's like a facade for accessing the minerva subsystems. This facade was the 'GameEngineLocal' in the "hotseat" version ;)

Since:
1.0
Version:
$Id: MinervaServerEngine.java 827 2010-07-06 21:07:53Z andre.koenig $

                        WorldFileNotFoundException,
                        WorldFileExtensionException,
                        WorldFileParseException,
                        WorldNotStorable,
                        DataAccessException
Imports the given world file via the importer class. Note that you have to upload the file before you can import it. Use ServerExecutables.prepareWorldFileImport(String) and write the file via FileChannel.

getWorlds

public java.util.Vector<World> getWorlds(boolean flatView)
                                  throws de.root1.simon.exceptions.SimonRemoteException,
                                         DataAccessException
Returns a list with all available worlds in a flat view. Flat view means, that each world doesn't hold the complete country dependencies (cool, for requesting an world overview).

Specified by:
getWorlds in interface ServerExecutables
Parameters:
flatView - Flat view = worlds without country dependencies (only meta data: name, description, etc.)
Returns:
A vector with the available worlds.
Throws:
de.root1.simon.exceptions.SimonRemoteException
DataAccessException

notifyClients

private void notifyClients()
                    throws de.root1.simon.exceptions.SimonRemoteException
Notifies all registered clients by invoking the "refreshPlayer" method on the client side. The client knows then, that something has changed.

Throws:
de.root1.simon.exceptions.SimonRemoteException
